education.institution: Boston University Metropolitan College, Boston, USA

courses: Principles of Data and System Security

work.name: Coupa Software
work.summary: Worked on application upgrades and cloud migration.
highlights: Gained a solid understanding of gem sets and the management of Ruby on Rails applications.
Upgraded an application across multiple Ruby versions while ensuring gemset compatibility.
Migrated a Docker-based Invoice Compliance Service to a cloud-based CCP Kubernetes.

projects.name: Cryptanalysis of Ciphers by Black Box Approach to Local Inversion
highlights: Analyzed computational efforts to recover encryption keys using a new black box approach.
Analyzed stream ciphers such as RC4 and block ciphers such as AES.
Calculated the Linear Complexity of various bit sequences for key retrieval.

projects.name: Clipboard History On Linux
highlights: An open-source application to record text-based clipboard contents persisting through boots for Wayland-based systems on Linux.
Set up a custom systemd script for launching the application.
Implemented a clipboard toggle using key combinations.

projects.name: Speeding up Scalar Multiplication over Elliptic Curves
highlights: Optimized ECC operations using parallel processing algorithms.
Designed a secure data type for handling cryptographic parameters on NIST P-Curves.
Implemented optimizations using Numba and NumPy, with performance analysis via Scalene.

projects.name: Security for the Internet of Things
highlights: Analyzed security protocols and encryption challenges in IoT environments.
Evaluated resource constraints for implementing ECC in IoT devices.
Proposed optimization techniques for secure communication.
